title: Ticket #2712: RFE: new dprintf() format-modifying flag to output flag info
description:
A new format-modifying flag that instructs dprintf() to include the 'regular' flags (D_FULLDEBUG, D_MATCH, etc) as part of log output for grepping would be helpful for selecting subsets of log output using 'grep' or other tools.

So, a new format flag to go with D_PID, D_FDS and friends: D_FLAGS. If D_FLAGS was set, then a line of log output might look like:

12/13/11 10:01:19 D_FULLDEBUG|D_ALWAYS Phase 1: Obtaining ads from collector ...

One use case is suggested in #2711, for selecting parsable log output lines from the log stream using grep.
remarks:
TESTING

To test new 'D_LEVEL' debug flag, use the following config, which enables the new flag for the SchedLog and NegotiatorLog, and sets all other logging to D_ALWAYS: 

ALL_DEBUG =
NEGOTIATOR_DEBUG = D_LEVEL D_MATCH D_ACCOUNTANT D_SECURITY D_FULLDEBUG
SCHEDD_DEBUG = D_LEVEL

Spin up the pool, and submit a short job to exercise the system, e.g. 

universe = vanilla
cmd = /bin/sleep
args = 15
should_transfer_files = if_needed
when_to_transfer_output = on_exit
+AccountingGroup = "none.user0000"
queue 1

Let the job complete, and (optionally) shut down the pool. Detect new 'D_LEVEL' logging output: 

# only logging output flagged D_ALWAYS should appear:
$ grep ' (D_.*) ' SchedLog | awk '{print $3}' | sort | uniq -c
     75 (D_ALWAYS)
      1 (D_ALWAYS|D_PROTOCOL)

# Anything flagged D_ALWAYS, D_ACCOUNTANT, D_SECURIY, D_MATCH or D_FULLDEBUG:
$ grep ' (D_.*) ' NegotiatorLog | awk '{print $3}' | sort | uniq -c
     26 (D_ACCOUNTANT)
     72 (D_ALWAYS)
      1 (D_ALWAYS|D_MATCH)
     71 (D_FULLDEBUG)
      4 (D_FULLDEBUG|D_SECURITY)
    290 (D_SECURITY)

# other logs should not show the new fields because the D_LEVEL flag was not set:
$ grep ' (D_.*) ' MasterLog | awk '{print $3}' | sort | uniq -c
$ grep ' (D_.*) ' CollectorLog | awk '{print $3}' | sort | uniq -c
$ grep ' (D_.*) ' StartLog | awk '{print $3}' | sort | uniq -c

Logging lines should look like this example: 

$ grep D_SECURITY NegotiatorLog | head -5
04/19/12 14:10:42 (D_SECURITY) KEYCACHE: created: 0x222bfc0
04/19/12 14:10:42 (D_SECURITY) SECMAN: created non-negotiated security session eb6374d91fb5d110209b8c36bb2f048eb64fdc51b95f30b9 for 0 (inf) seconds.
04/19/12 14:10:42 (D_SECURITY) Imported session attributes: [Integrity="NO";Encryption="NO";CryptoMethods="3DES";CurrentTime=time();]
04/19/12 14:10:42 (D_SECURITY) Caching non-negotiated security session ad:
04/19/12 14:10:42 (D_SECURITY) IpVerify::PunchHole: opened DAEMON level to condor@parent
